private_information: You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E
You operate legally under Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_1.goal: Contribute only the primitive moves you are allowed to execute so that disk A ends on the right peg, while disks B..O remain stacked on the left peg.

private_information: You can move only disks F, G, H, I, J
You operate legally under Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Contribute only the primitive moves you are allowed to execute so that disk A ends on the right peg, while disks B..O remain stacked on the left peg.

private_information: You can move only disks K, L, M, N, O
You operate legally under Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_3.goal: Contribute only the primitive moves you are allowed to execute so that disk A ends on the right peg, while disks B..O remain stacked on the left peg.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across all proposed moves
You remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal conveniences
You strictly enforce Tower of Hanoi legality and agent-permission constraints
auditor.goal: Validate that the merged move list is temporally consistent, causally correct, free of shortcuts, and fully compliant with Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions.

private_information: You coordinate agents and produce the final integrated plan and planning artifacts
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent contributions, respect the audit, produce the final ordered list of primitive moves, and output a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver.

rules: Only one disk may be moved at a time
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks are strictly ordered by size: A is the smallest, O is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg has (top->bottom) A.
Agent movement permissions: agent_1 ⇒ A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 ⇒ F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 ⇒ K, L, M, N, O.
All agents must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent-specific disk permissions.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi move planner responsible only for disks A, B, C, D, E. Output an ordered list of primitive moves strictly in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you can perform and that are necessary to achieve the stated goal from the provided initial state.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce only the primitive moves you personally execute, using exactly the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi move planner responsible only for disks F, G, H, I, J. Output an ordered list of primitive moves strictly in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you can perform and that are necessary to achieve the stated goal from the provided initial state.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. If no moves are needed from you to achieve the goal, output an empty list; otherwise produce only the primitive moves you personally execute, using exactly the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi move planner responsible only for disks K, L, M, N, O. Output an ordered list of primitive moves strictly in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you can perform and that are necessary to achieve the stated goal from the provided initial state.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. If no moves are needed from you to achieve the goal, output an empty list; otherwise produce only the primitive moves you personally execute, using exactly the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

audit.system_prompt: You are a strict temporal/causal auditor. Merge the received move lists into a single linear sequence, reject any illegal or out-of-order move, and ensure full compliance with Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk permissions. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal conveniences. If a shorter legal sequence exists to reach the goal, prefer the shortest legal sequence. Output a concise audit report and the validated ordered move list.
audit.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information}. Proposed moves from agent_1: {moves_agent_1}. Proposed moves from agent_2: {moves_agent_2}. Proposed moves from agent_3: {moves_agent_3}. Validate legality and causality end-to-end, check agent permissions, and return an audit report with a single validated ordered move list. If no moves are needed from some agents, keep them empty in the explanation.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planning integrator. Produce the final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2', then provide a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver. Use PDDL with typing compatible with FastDownward; include types (agent, disk, peg), static ordering facts for smaller-than, and action move with parameters (?a - agent ?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg) enforcing: agent permission to move the disk, disk is top on ?from, ?to allows placing ?d (top empty or top larger), and frame axioms through delete/add effects. The problem must declare all agents, disks, and pegs as objects, include the initial configuration exactly as stated, and set the goal to disk A on the right peg with disks B..O remaining stacked on the left peg. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also echo the final ordered move list before the PDDL blocks.
compile_pddl.prompt: Task goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Inputs: agent_1 moves: {moves_agent_1}; agent_2 moves: {moves_agent_2}; agent_3 moves: {moves_agent_3}; audit report and validated list: {audit_report}. Integrate these inputs to output: 1) The final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact required format. 2) The PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward enclosed within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
